description:
I love this place! I'll start off by saying that this is one of the few places that warmly welcomes in your furry friends, which is so awesome! I've brought my dog here several times, weekday nights, weekends, even late night on weekends, and it has never been an issue. The bartenders always seem happy to see dogs come in and even have treats to give them. 

The dog thing is pretty awesome, but that's not the only cool thing about this place. The drinks are great, the ambiance is comfortable and welcoming, and the people are always friendly. Wednesday game night is always really fun too! They have several TVs to watch games on and board games to play if you're feeling a game of catan or dominoes!
author: Taylor K.

description:
Had some time (about 3 hours worth) before our reservation at House of Prime Rib. We got here just as the first quarter of Game 2 of the NBA Finals began, but there were still a few seats at the bar open. We immediately sat and was greeted by one of the bartenders. They've got about 6-8 beers on tap (don't really remember the exact number), wine, and JERKY! I'm 100% sure there are other drinks and some food, but those are the only ones that I ordered/saw myself (without looking at the menu).

There are AMPLE TVs along both walls. The Cabin itself is more like a very long hallway. But there is still room for a line of people to stand in front of the bar with the people sitting there as well. It wasn't too loud like other places I've been too, but still had high energy (I mean, everyone is cheering for the warriors so).

All in all, if I need to go to a bar that isn't going to be too crowded for a sports game...this is the place!
author: Kerynne T.

description:
Amazing bar, amazing bar staff, amazing patrons. Amazing drink specials, amazing Japanese whiskey flight, amazing game selections left by some regulars. 

So happy we came across this place, we had an... amazing... time chatting with the the bartender and playing backgammon. They have SCYTHE!! For all you board game geeks out there. 

Shot of fernet for only A DOLLAR with beer purchase. Japanese whiskey flight was so worth it. Can't wait to go back. 

We will miss you Amy, John, and red-shirted bartender.
author: Brittany F.

description: The bartenders here are attentive, make excellent drinks, and look out for their patrons. While I was there with a friend, we had someone be a little weird and aggressive to us and it was handled BEFORE we could even point it out and say something. They look out for people's safety here and want to make sure everyone has a good time. Go here. You can enjoy yourself with none of the sketchiness.
author: Njeri P.

description:
I would call Cabin an upscale sports bar. We came for drinks, bites, and to watch the Warriors play the Cavs. The place itself isn't that large so I wouldn't recommend coming with a big group unless most of you are fine with standing. They were offering 3 food options from a place around the corner called 1760. 

$11 Crispy chicken tenders - WHAT. The price is just wow. $11 for 4 small chicken nugget sized pieces of meat. Overpriced, but I'll have to mention that they tasted good with the green sauce that came with them. We were also absolutely starving and needed sustenance. Ordered out of desperation.

$11 Duck slider - Offered on the menu, but we decided against it. 

 $8 Pre-packaged Righteous Beef Jerky -  Multiple flavor options, but again overpriced for what you get. We got the Sweet BBQ version and it was really dry and tough. Would not recommend.

Cocktails for ~ $11 each. 

Pros:
- TVs by the bar to watch games 
- Great alcohol selection (Lagavulin, Laphroaig and more)
- Draft beer selections are solid
- Dollar shot with purchase of draft beer on dollar days

Tips/notes: 
- Not good for groups of more than 2-4
- Bar area gets crowded easily 
- If you get bar seats and it's crowded (like on game days), be prepared for people to be all up in your personal space
- Not good for dates if it's crowded, people will be poking in between you to order drinks 
- Pretty noisy, be prepared to talk loudly or get close and comfortable in the hopes of having a conversation 
- We found out that outside food is allowed. This would've been good to know before ordering the overpriced food. We ended up getting pizza from around the corner :D

Overall an A-okay place, but I'd only return on a calm day when the place isn't packed.
author: Saachi G.

description: This place is a cocktail AND sports bar. They have a variety of specialty cocktails on the menu and they have televisions to watch sports. I tried a vodka smash which was yummy. They also have a ton of board games if you want a place to drink and play games. Service was a bit slow but overall, cool spot.
author: Christine A.

description:
Such a great find . We stopped in for a birthday cocktail before dinner and it was a great choice!! 
Reasonable drinks and a huge wall of so many varieties...... you can't go wrong. The bartender was super nice and the atmosphere was chill
author: Amber E.

description: Fun hangout spot, great atmosphere, friendly bartenders. Thumbs up!
author: Christina N.

description: Looked like a work party or family reunion commencing karaoke. From outside they have flashy strobe lights drawing groups in but it's not as hype as the lights!
author: Monique W.

description:
Great kamakaze!  Cabin was one of our destinations for Santa Con and it was packed!!!!!!!  That didn't stop the bartenders from keeping up with the demand of drinks from the santas wandering around the bar.  

I'm not sure of all the specifics of their menu because they had a lot of santa con specials for the day.  They sure were all good though.  Lots of delicious and potent shooters being served for us all to enjoy!

I will definitely want to come back to Cabin and explore the scene here when it's not so crowded and not a big San Francisco function.  Can't wait though.  I really love the area and want to do some more exploring around the city in these parts.  

I'll for sure come back and write some updates about how the night plays out on a non-santa con night!
author: Kevin K.

description:
Love the Cabin!  Great atmosphere, great staff.  They also have my favorite Bourbon County Stout on draft!  Actually going there with my girl friend tonight!

Ex Restaurant Manager 
Purdue Hospitality Graduate
author: Jon R.

description:
Stopped by for a quick round of drinks on Tuesday, November 24th at 7:15pm before dinner.

We ordered the Cabin quencher: dickel rye, cock and bull ginger beer, mint, lemon and another cabin something drink. I can't recall the name for the life of me, but looking at their online menu, I remember the description being similar to the campfire, except with bourbon and strawberry shrub. Unfortunately they ran out of shrub and couldn't make our drink, so our bartender Rebecca recommended another drink. I believe it was called something like Indian summer. Regardless, I liked both drinks and the bustling bar atmosphere.

Fun quick stop before dinner.
author: Elena N.

description:
Cozy, cabin-y style cocktail bar with tvs. Yelp calls this place a sports bar, but if I don't see buckets of cheap beer or a single jersey being worn, I don't feel a place is a sports bar! This place is definitely more upscale than that, which is still quite nice.

We stopped in for one cocktail, and they certainly made mine strong! I had the dark and stormy, which was decent, but not fantastic. The place is long and narrow with bar seats and many small tables lining the walls to the back. When we walked in, it look liked the place was full, but it wasn't, so definitely give the back a check before walking out. 

There wasn't any table servers, which would've elevated the experience, but we still had an OK time.
author: Suzanne B.

description: Really nice place, not too big. So it gives a bit intimacy. The wood decoration gauge me a comfortable vibe there. c
author: Tom T.

description: We went here to watch the NCAA games.   The beers and service were great!  This is a great place to escape the tourist areas.
author: james p.

description: Pretty unique hybrid sports bar with an upscale feel . Drinks and service was excellent and they have just enough TVs to watch your game . A posh alternative to a sports bar . Didn't eat but it looked very good and was of a fusion sort
author: Mr. J.

description: Clyde is an amazing freakin Bartender. Over the top customer service and try to fix whatever you like to your taste. I recommend this be on a scale of 1-10 an 9......... only because nobody is perfect but they are perfect for you
author: B'Nic G.

description:
Nice cocktail bar on Polk. 

Quite narrow with some tables at the back and fake fireplace on a tv screen.  They also have board games to play - always a nice touch. Overall I liked the feel of the place. 

Bartender was nice (but perhaps busy a bit too much with friends). Good mix of people and crowded but not too much so on a sat night. 

I asked bartender to make me something with rum and that tasted tropical. He made a valid effort that could be respected. 

Perhaps biggest negative was the price but likely not extreme for typical SF cocktail bar.  Would probably visit this place again. 


.
author: Greg A.

description:
I like this bar. It's kind of a weird set up because you walk in and the bar is on the right and then there's a narrow hallway, and then it opens up a little in the back. It's kind of small, but I had a fun time there. Drinks were reasonable priced, and I got a vodka, soda, lavender which was really good but also kind of sweet. 

It's close to other fun bars on polk too so I would definitely want to come here again when I'm having a chill night with drinks, but not trying to go crazy and dance.
author: Jenna G.

description:
After arriving in San Francisco in the early afternoon, we were looking to do a little cocktail exploring before dinner (okay very early pre-dinner cocktail).  Thanks Yelp for the info!

After a very long walk from our hotel, I was definitely ready for something cold.The drinks were well made (they can do the classics!) and the service very friendly.  Rebecca was the best.  She even made me something not on the menu when asked.  I know if we make our way back some day, we will visit here again!
author: Carol W.

description: Super friendly, great service! Nice atmosphere. Enjoyed the beer and 1$ shot! I will be back the next time we come to San Fran.
author: Chris A.

description:
This has been one of my go to chill spots on polk. Great drinks and always have good tunes. I was there last night with some friends and they were playing Pokemon Go and instead of hating on us the bartender gave us tips!

Cabin I love you.
author: Shannon D.

description:
Bartender was new, she looked like she was nervous because the other bartender was looking over her shoulder. She kept her cool and was still nice. The drinks were ok, a little pricey! The wife did not really like her lavender vodka drink, and I agree it was too sweet. I wouldn't go back because it's just not my "vibe". 

Give it a try, it might be for you!
author: Eddie H.

description: I love this place. We went to check this place out before we went to house of prime rib and it was pretty awesome. We left the bartender make us any drink that he wanted to and it was strong yet pleasant. The staff here are cool and the Decour it's pimp ass. This is definitely a place you want to take some friends sit back and relax and just enjoy a few cocktails before heading out. Do yourself a favor and Uber it there because you will leave lit.
author: Marcus S.

description:
In a city like San Francisco, what does it take to push a bar from "good" to "great"?

Cabin has found that answer.

While Polk street isn't my go-to hood', I have frequented Cabin with groups as it is the un-official Houston Texans meet up bar (or all Houston teams, for that matter). Our fearless leader who plans said outings worked with the staff to show our games with sound and even offer drink specials from time to time. I had always tipped my hat for accommodating large groups (sometimes 40+ people) who are rowdy watching their team ultimately suck. 

As of late I have grown a whole new appreciate for Cabin outside of football season.

Décor: vie been about 20x and just realized IT LOOKS LIKE A LOG CABIN INSIDE. Maybe I was just so focused on my games, but I just saw this. It has a warm, home-y touch to it with scenic paintings and fireplace on the TV. Aside from the themey décor, there are about 12 televisions playing everything from sports to family guy. Ask nicely and you can easily have your own screen to watch your team, or golf.... Or hell, the bachelor if that's your thing. Nobody is judging.

Drinks:
Dare I say, best bloody Mary in San Francisco. Bold statement, I know, but I've tried most (if not all) "best bloody" in SF and theirs is up there. Perfectly spicy, enough vodka to get you feeling up to par and beautifully garnished. After one, you're ready to conquer the world..... or at very least, be a contributor to society.
Amazing rotating craft beers on tap, a large and well thought out cocktail menu, a $25 fernet flight (if you're feeling frisky) and one of the largest bourbon/scotch selections in SF (along with barrel aged house cocktails).

Food:
No frills light bar bites. Gourmet jerky, nuts, etc. I've been told you can bring outside food or have food delivered, but don't quote me on it. With the abundance of food around Polk, you can't go wrong.

Service:
Game changing. Rebecca and Jen are the nicest and most welcoming bartenders on Polk street, hands down. Everyone is welcomed, engaged and served timely. If you have questions, they answer without the tude of other bars and are super easy to talk to. Every time I come in, Rebecca remembers me, my drink and my story. I don't feel like I'm in a random bar on Polk, I feel like I'm talking amongst friends. Advice to management: these girls deserve a raise and are absolutely an asset. 

A friend said it best, "it feels like a non-Polk street Polk street bar" and for all the above stated reasons, my loyalty and patronage is with ya!

Tips:
-Effective March 1 there is a new cocktail menu
-FANTASTIC reverse happy hour (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cabin-san-francisco?select=_hGA6OHv30iG0qA7GfMTMQ)
-great, huge window in the front great for people watching and nice, sunny days.
author: Ryan L.

description: We stumbled in with a group of girls on a Monday after xmas, when every other bar was closed. Jessica is an amazing bar keep. She single handedly took care of the entire bar and made sure everyone was happy with their drinks. She was able to actively attend to people in the back tables, a full bar, and front window seating with great efficiency and grace. Friendly, but not too chatty. Funny, but not overpowering. Will definitely be back for her whiskey sours and the relaxed ambiance.
author: Judy L.

description:
If you're into sports bars or bars in general, Cabin is the place to go. As a regular, I may be biased, but I feel confident that the bartenders there are the nicest around. 

On weekdays Cabin maintains a relatively small crowd of young professionals, sports fans, and regular guys and gals. Because it's not packed to the brim Sunday - Thursday, it's a good spot for catching up with old friends and meeting new ones. It's the kind of place where you don't have to ask, "Wait, what did you say?!" over and over.

On weekends It's typically packed to the brim. Fortunately there's a fair amount of space near the back, so you never feel claustrophobic. It does get pretty cramped near the bar, but the bartenders are fast and attentive.

The bartenders know their alcohol, and it shows. On a slow night you can ask them to make just about anything, and you'll be pleasantly surprised with the results. 

This place has definitely won me over. Cheers!
author: Scott D.

description:
It seemed like yuppies and the B&T crowd go here though I've no problem with that. I like how it's a basic bar and not a dive bar so it's cleaner. The bar has TVs with local sports teams on all the time so that is a plus. Also, it was loud but not unbearably loud. The last visit was on a Tuesday night and the place was crowded but not packed.

Their cocktails are potent and, while not cheap, prices are reasonable. On the last visit our friendly and attentive bartender gave us suggestions on cocktails and even a mocktail. The Cabin Quencher was refreshing for a strong drink.

Cabin is a nice bar and I would return. Too bad it is out of the way from home and work or else it would probably in my rotation.
author: Peter L.

description: This is a cool bar and my drink was good! Service in the other hand left something to be desired. The bar tender, Amanda, was rude to us and made us feel like as newcomers to the bar, we weren't welcome. Honestly, her attitude tainted an otherwise positive experience.
author: Steph W.

description:
I never set foot in the old Bigfoot.  From what I've heard, I wasn't missing out on a lot - another dive bar on a part of Polk Street that is out-growing dive bars.  Well, out went Parilla next door, in came 1760 (que Swank!).  Out went the Red Devil, in came Harper and Rye.  Out went Bigfoot, and in came The Cabin.  (Still waiting to see what replaces Big Apple Foods)  So, gentrification is a fact of life in SF, and Polk Gulch is upgrading too.  Not that this was a marginal neighborhood before, but now it is getting even classier.  The Cabin is a good compromise in terms of the changes.  

I like a friendly dive bar.  Generally, this is because I want to relax and not feel like I'm on display.  I like bartenders who converse - I like fellow patrons who are interesting to shoot the breeze with.  But, I'm getting older, and I do enjoy being in a place where I don't get spare-changed in the bar, or find myself next to a person who is way over the line.  I like my Upper-Polk (PolkNob?) standard of Street/Bar behavior.

The Cabin is definitely not a dive bar, but it's not a super high-end cocktail lounge either.  This falls into the category of a nice bar which is nice-casual.  If you're in during the afternoon or weekends, it's pretty relaxed.  Lots of TV's, so it's not a bad place to watch the games.  I hear Sundays get busy for 49ers.  The after-work vibe is pretty much on par for the neighborhood - it's the folks who live on Upper-Polk, West Nob Hill, Russian Hill - generally a late-20's'/30's age range.  It's people who want to relax and have drinks and a conversation.  You can feel fine in a suit, or shorts and a t-shirt.  I'm almost always in work clothes.  BTW - I dig the log-cabin feel (which I think is a remnant from the Bigfoot days)

Brass-Tacks:  They have a nice cocktail list.  Very nice full bar (it is actually a lovely presentation) and a good range of beer, wine, spirits.  Prices are about as expected, and there is a Happy Hour.  I've thought the bartenders are all pretty solid and have been good to chat with.  Overall, nothing missing, but nothing truly exceptional or cant-miss.  It's not as high-end as a Redford or Harper and Rye, but it's also not super casual.  It's relaxing and a good after-work spot, with lots of TV's.
author: Adam S.

description:
I don't remember this bar being so expensive. I've been coming here since the place was "Bigfoot" (a much more unique San Francisco bar that of course no longer exists because god forbid there's a place that seems to contain a soul in SF anymore), the bartenders were nice enough, but definitely stiffed us on our drinks. Our two drinks cost $30 including tip.I saw the vodka gimlet on the menu and asked for gin instead, I was asked a preference and just picked a gin from the bar, but wasn't told until the bill came that my choice would hike my drink from $11 to $14! You should absolutely let a customer know that sort of thing instead of assuming it's alright. To add insult to injury the drink itself was mediocre at best.

  My boyfriend ordered a Knob Creek neat, they gave him less then a shots worth and it was $12.50! Give me a break! I'm absolutely disgusted. Not sure I'll be heading back to Cabin anytime soon. If you're looking for cocktails that are actually good try out Hi-Lo right down the street on Polk, they have much better drinks with a less douchie atmosphere too.
author: Mary S.

description:
Purchased a Groupon pass for Cabin for a quick weekend in SF with my man, and had no ideas on what to expect. Arrived late on a Saturday night, and found Cabin to be like your favorite chocolate lab- loud, unique, dark, and friendly. 

We were greeted by an outgoing bartender who helped us sort our starter drinks, and we looked over the rest of our menus for what our next choices were going to be. They had a great mix of late 90's early 2000's pop and r&b, along with screens showing a multitude of sports. This is a barhopper's paradise! 

Our first drinks were the Melon Marguerite ($10) and the Pear Cooler ($11), the former being fresh and bursting with melon goodness, the latter being one of the most refreshing, light, delicious, and positively girly drinks I've had to date. Round two consisted of the citrusy and dangerously easy to drink Daywalker ($11), and the seasonally fun Blackberry Blanco ($11). Last call we went for the tangy and feisty Cabin Quencher ($9) and the Yellow Tricycle ($11), which was the only drink of the evening I wasn't fond of, but that's probably just because I don't like Prosecco. 

Drinks were made quickly, bartenders were friendly ( shout out to the bartender who kept calling me baby girl- hayyyy), and the music was loud, but hey, it's the weekend, live a little. Definitely interesting and new flavor combos, including the intriguing house made Hibiscus syrup. Glad to see places like this popping up, because I know that I speak for many of us, but I just can't get enough of craft cocktails. Still working through the kinks of new ownership, like the music stopping randomly and the TV's having focusing issues, but I know a good thing when I see it. Enjoy, SF!
author: Leah S.

description: One of my favorite bars for some Saturday afternoon libations when visiting SF. Very chill atmosphere, drink prices are reasonable and they always have some great beers on tap to sip on while you watch the game of your choice. I wish I could remember the name of the chick who was bartending this past Saturday she was hella cool to chat with, kept the drinks coming and made our experience twice as great as previous times. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a lowkey place to drink and catch up with friend or just watch a game.
author: Quisha H.

description:
I really, really enjoyed Cabin! We were lucky enough to grab ample seating next to the window and it wasn't overly noisy so my friends could hear all my ridiculously awesome and effective pick up lines. 

Polar bears anyone?

I tried a few different drinks from their fall menu and was pleasantly surprised that they were well-balanced, not overly sweet and well crafted. The pumpkin old fashioned was much better than it sounded and that bacon bloody mary thing was amazing. 

I'd absolutely be back for drinks. And for those dirty dogs doing their thang 10 feet away outside.
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
The bloody Mary's are amazing!!! They are expertly made by Rebecca with a ton of different ingredients. Here are the ones I remember:
3 kinds of hot sauce
Homemade tomato juice
Worcestershire
Guinness (yes they add a dash of beer!!!)
Horseradish
Black pepper
Secret pepper blend
Pickled asparagus
Cucumbers
Pickled green bean

Hmmmm I'm sure there's more and I'll update when I return.
author: Ariel E.

description:
Went hear with 6 people between 11pm to 12:15am on 12/10.  We sat at the table in the back between the bar and the restroom.    We had 2 rounds of Jack Daniel shots and likely spend about $150 there.  We were well behaved, mind our own business, was not loud or causing trouble.

At mid night one of our friend fell as sleep on the table.  One of the employee (caucasian male with a small beard) came over and said in a bad tone, "she has to get out, you guys have to get out, she cannot fall asleep here".  We asked,"what do you mean, she did not do anything to you".   He then repoeated again in a bad tone, "you guys have to get out 8now, she cannot sleep here".   We then said, "we just spend $150 here, we didnt do anything wrong,you cant just be rude like this". We then woke our friends up, got her to the bathroom to freshen up.   I then proceeded to the bar to talk to someone there to question the one employee reasoning.   The Asian guy at the bar was decent, he looked calm, he said something that I could not hear.  At this point, my friend just pulled me and said let's just go.  

Seriously, the way that 1st employee approached us left such a bad impression.  Why does that person had to be so rude.   I owns several business in sf and if that is my employee, I would fire him immediately.  How about asking whether my friend is ok?  Whether she was completely wasted or just a light sleep?  Does she need water, etc?  Those polite questions are the typical response from most bars.   I also own a bar business, I know.

I would never go back to this place again given how that person handled and was rude to us.
author: Tom L.

description:
Solid option on Polk street for some drinks. This place is small but it is typically not too busy so I am usually able to find a spot at the bar or one of the high tops in the back .
ATMOSPHERE:
Cabin is a bit cleaner and better quality compared to a lot of the places near by. There are a lot of TVs so this is a go to place to watch some games without a crazy crowd. Cabin is clean, inviting, and comfortable. 
DRINKS:
Good cocktail selection ($10 - $13), decent draft beers and a full bar with pretty much anything you could think of. Happy hour lasts until 7PM nightly including cocktail and beer specials. Also there are beer and bloody mary deals on football Sundays (yay - the bloody mary has a nice kick). 
SERVICE:
Always nice bartenders. Very prompt, quick to give advice and if they are busy always willing to at least acknowledge you and let you know they will be right with you. 
all in all a decent place to enjoy a drink, nothing crazy but always consistent and good.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Henry-- the manager-- is an idiot. 

This used to be our neighborhood bar (yes, even back when it was the Bigfoot.  Loved that place.  After the remodel it lost its soul, but was still OK).  Fine drinks, lots of TVs (though the ergonomics are a bit off), and helpful-- but overworked-- bartenders (Rebecca is especially thoughtful and attentive).  

So now Henry decides to charge for UFC, and those of us who are there to watch the Olympics or the NFL (and yeah, we arrived way early) get kicked out.  

Fuck Henry.  I'll go elsewhere.
author: Mark J.

description: I came here on a Monday night after dinner and I was happy to see that they had late night happy hour. They have a good number of different beers on the menu. For late night happy hour, there is a deal where you can get a shot for $1 with the purchase of a beer or vice versa. Our bartender was super friendly, and I liked how it was a slow night and there were tables available and you can actually talk to people at a normal voice level. They also have board games available for you to play if you wanted. I am looking forward to coming back here again.
author: Lynn T.

description: I recently visited this bar with a friend and had one of the worst experiences. I don't usually go out of my way to write reviews for bad service but this was something else. ( I'm also a bartender so this just annoyed me even more) as we walked in I noticed there was a tall guy working along side a girl. We sat down waiting patiently for a drink and after a few minutes of the bartenders still chatting and not leaving conversations finally came over and acted annoyed that he had to even get our order. The guy had a very monotone voice on purpose and made sarcastic comments about how he had to pour us drinks. Still at this point I wasn't angry and was trying to be in high spirits. It came to the point where we had to pay and I put money out there and so did my friend. The bartender took both of our money and stayed at the register for over 10 minutes. I figured maybe It was a money switch or something with their bank they were fixing. Another 5 minutes passed and the guy turned around and started talking to the other bartender and engaged in a conversation with another customer. At this point we start signaling both of them to come over to which I see the guy look in our direction and quickly ignore us and turn away. The girl eventually comes over but acts like nothing happened. The guys continues to ignore us up until we leave and looks away from us anytime we try to make contact. Working at a bar I've seen other bartenders pull this crap on people to scam them and play dumb but really? I would have tipped you decent anyways but not near a $30 tip off a half of pint we each ordered. Especially after  being rude during most of the initial interaction. Thanks for the scam and happy holidays
author: Dom L.

description: Best bar chill relax come and ask for clyde he is the plug like amazing helps you  relax
author: Nicole N.

description:
Evens during THE Santa con, Jessica and Rebecca gave the best service I have seen in my days in SF. Very attentive and please request them going forward. They are the best of the best. 

Love,
Jake
author: Jake M.

description:
YAY for girls night out! 

Douchiest of douchebags plops himself at our table: "hey girls, when are you gonna buy me a drink?!"   

Now, I remember why I HATE this place. 

Two stars for the bartender taking his shirt off while closing up the bar. RAWR.
author: Janice C.

description: Great little spot. They few times I've been the bartenders have been super cool and the crowd was a good mix of people. Feels like every time I go it's happy hour, so can't complain. Need to come back during peak hours to see how it really is before I give it 5 stars. But so far so good.
author: Kyle L.

description:
My favorite neighborhood bar! I live across the street and love going to this bar for casual drinks with friends or watching the game. All of the bartenders are super nice and friendly. They always say bye when you leave...how many bars pay attention to that level of detail? I love it. 

They have a great selection of alcohol and is always up to recommend new things when you're in the mood. I tend to stick to my usual, but now I'm addicted to their jalepeno cucumber gimlet. It's the right amount to spicy and tart. 

They don't serve food, but if you're hungry, you can bring food in. No problem!! 

Go here for bloody Mary's also... Perfect for recovery on Sundays.
author: Vicky T.

description:
Best chill bar on Polk Street!
The atmosphere, music, drinks, and bartender (Jen) deserve an A+
I am a first timer and a newbie to the neighborhood. We sat at the bar and ordered 2 bloody marys. Can i say that, that BM was amazing! Jen is a really knowledgeable and great bartender! I am not a heavy drinker nor do I know anything about liquor...Jen explained to me the differences between certain liquors, she also explained how the bottles are organized on the shelves and also recommended one of her favorite drinks, Michter's American Whiskey....so good! went down smooth and tasted like vanilla! She also recommended Penddleton since I like crown. I will definitely pick it up at Costco. 
Thank you Jen for a pleasant evening!
author: Darcie P.

description: I think the bartender was new, I ordered a lavender drink cannot remember the name . It was so awkwardly tasting like no thought put into it .  Besides that bar was pretty chill they have games u can play and cool music . Definitely give it a try .
author: Evelyn L.

description:
Cabin is an upgrade from Bigfoot Lounge before and I like what they've done to open up the space in the back. Overall, prefer leisure day drinking here versus being packed in on weekend nights.

It's pretty casual on weekend afternoons where the friendly bartender will hook you up with a pretty satisfying bloody mary or a cool pint as you soak in some sunshine. That is if you get the seat by the only window in the place. Plus happy hours till 7 and you get to enjoy the faux cabin experience across from the bar. 

It gets packed at night and I wished they made more space around the bar like they did in the back. It's often a bottleneck around there on the weekend. Overall a step up from before and a decent bar for drinks on a street that in increasingly teeming with choices to booze up.
author: Jon L.

description: Liked it. The name Cabin acutely describes what it looks like inside like Jeremiah Johnson would be there. Bartenders very helpful.  Cool music and vibe.
author: Rick R.

description:
A few of us stopped in for a cocktail (or two) on Saturday night. The doorman let us in and we found a table in the back that seemed comfortable and nice. A guy came by to tell us that despite there being a menu on the the table, there was no table service, and that we'd have to order at the bar. Odd, given how small the bar is, but fine. A few minutes after settling in with our drinks, we noticed that the noise level in the bar had gotten really loud -- and in the meantime, someone had thrown up in the corner near our table. They came over to clean it up (poor guy whose job that was) and we were left choking on the deodorizing spray that he used to mask the terrible smell.

It's a bar, I get it . . . but the ambiance was certainly lacking and the service mediocre at best.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
Clean, uncrowded bar with lots of televisions & bar tables with an unassuming yet modern interior. It's a welcome departure from the more grungy & older bars further South on Polk.

I think there were 8-10 craft beers on tap, a decent wine selection, and a page worth of $9-13 cocktails to try. The top shelf liquor selection was also pretty extensive, more than what I would expect for a bar that floats between being a neighborhood bar to a nicer lounge for locals. Happy hour lasts till 7pm and also on Sunday-Wednesday nights they hold "Industry nights" which means happy hour 10pm to close.

Cabin has friendly bartenders who know how to finely craft their cocktails & aren't rushed while doing so, which is something I can appreciate since the SF mixology scene continues to grow every year. I'd recommend ordering the Golden Delicious if you like a refreshing rum drink, or Cabin's take on the classic Pimm's Cup.

Chill bar, great drinks, and great prices, what's not to like?
author: Steven C.

description:
Low key and easy. Nice bartender who gave us lots of tips. During happy hour you get a few dollars off the signature cocktails.  
If you are in the area give it a try.
author: Joe M.

description:
Another great place to stop by while bar hopping along Polk. The vibe is intimate  yet lively and have an adequate about of seating although be warned fills up fast.

A solid selection of both spirits and draft beers

Overall Thoughts

I've been back twice now with no complaints =)
author: Eddie W.

description:
I took myself on a little adventure yesterday after work. My friends were beckoning me to Cabin on Polk, so I of course took the wrong bus all the way to Fillmore and proceeded to walk all the way down to Geary, rather than just one block up from California to Sacramento to take the 1 back to Polk. And my shoes were new and *extremely* uncomfortable. But hey, since I decided to forego the gym, the little walkabout I went on can count as my exercise for the day.

Cabin is cute and seems like it would belong in the Financial District. It reminded me a lot of Rickhouse on Kearny. Cool vibes, mixed crowd, but pretty dead at 6PM on a Thursday, but I'm sure during the weekend or maybe even just later on the evening it gets mo' poppin'.
author: Crystal C.

description: The place was incredibly dark inside, they need more lights, definitely known for their cocktails. Sangria was yummy. One bartender, she was swamped, so service was a little slow.
author: Brianna L.

description:
San Francisco has been a wonderful place. Great bars and restaurants to visit. However The Cabin is by far the worst bar I have ever been too. This includes places in Oklahoma and South Carolina.  

The bar environment was nice and welcoming. 

Draft and bottled beers where good.

Mixed drinks from the female bartender where so bad we sent them back twice, she also made remarks towards my wife that made us leave promptly. 

I'd say check this place out for a beer and the local patrons; their nice people. But if there's a female bartender - stay away!!!
author: Ian S.

description:
I've been to the Cabin a few times, and admittedly I have a hard time letting go. I loved the divey feel of Big Foot Lodge, and miss it.

I'll give props to the Cabin for the updated interior, and cabiny feel; and the additional tvs to watch sporting events. I'm not sure about you, but when I'm in a cabin, I don't feel like watching tv. There are Happy Hour specials, so check it out if you're there early enough. The Cabin has a decent selection of beers on draft, and cocktails are ok, not great. Bartenders are friendly and at times efficient. 

Anyway, the biggest disappointment here is that the Big Foot is no longer in the building. He was the mainstay of Big Foot Lodge. As you can see, I have problems with change. This dive bar diva may give the Cabin another try, but will look elsewhere to get that divey Big Foot loving feeling back, cause it's gone.. gone.. gone.. woooaaa....!
author: Gill C.

description:
Cabin is a great spot on Polk- anytime. I've been here twice during "off" hours, and it's been enjoyable and still had a great mixed group there!

The cocktails are well-crafted and constantly rotating- which is impressive to get those on point, and on rotation! Cabin is a nice environment too and has great, reasonable pitchers on tap.
author: Kerry G.

description:
A cool, dark bar.

I showed up with a group of people killing time before a wedding reception.  I ordered four martinis and the bartender knocked them out efficiently while still helping other customers.  He was a one-man wrecking crew.

The Black Buffalo (Buffalo Trace whisky, Averna, Angostura bitters, maraschino cherry) was strooooooong, but tasty.

I walked out without my credit card and the bartender chased me down in the street to return it.

Cabin deserves your patronage.  Make a point to drop in for a drink.
author: Ben B.

description: This place is simply mismanaged drunk bartenders one short one who does not tend the bar with any tactic! The bar signed up to be a part of the Halloween bar crawl, yet does not staff correctly! Shame on you and shame on the way you run a business! This place would be shut down in any other state!
author: Anonymous T.

description: it's a chill place with a lot of TVs. Came here before a HOPR reservation and watched half of the warriors game. It was empty which is good in my opinion. The staff was nice and I didn't have to wait too long for my drinks. They have a decent draft beer selection.
author: Tony L.

description:
Protip: Check groupon to see whether Cabin is offering an awesome sale. I've paid $11 for $24 worth of drinks.

This is one of  my favorite places on Polk Street. Imagine Jackalope but older and more mature. 

This place has a bit of a Marina vibe, but the crowd is older and more mature.  The selection of beer, spirits, and cocktails are solid.
author: Robert F.

description:
Goodbye Bigfoot Lodge, hello Cabin!

They kept the rustic wooden decor and lodgey feel, but took out the extra manly-man cabin decor like scary animal heads and statues. Instead, they kept it minimal and added over a dozen screens to truly cement the place as a prime sports bar on Polk St. 

The atmosphere is tight and cozy and filled with excitement over SF sports. Go niners!

Drink prices are the "uge" at $5 for most brands on tap. They only offer drinks here, so make sure you're all filled up when you visit. 

Oh and I found something very peculiar here. A handful of people brought in food from nearby businesses and started chowing them on the bar! Seems like a great idea--grab a huge sando from Millers across the street or a shawarma from Le Ptit Marchet next door and have yourself a little party. Hopefully they don't crank down on this behavior. 

---

Distinguishing factor: Solid sports bar with a very unique wooden cabin feel from floor to ceiling. They're definitely true to their name here.
author: Nick A.

description: This rustic bar is my favorite. Their drinks are strong and the bartenders are really nice. Love the interior!
author: Katie P.

description:
Love this spot. It gets crowded but if you come early, you can get a table. There was one blip that happened. We ordered two old fashions, but one came a bit shorter (about a whole centimeter). I let Amber know and unlike other bars, she took care of it.

They brought us an extra old fashioned. We were satisfied and this is why I frequent this venue with my colleagues.

Come here to be treated with respect, taste delicious drinks like the jalapeño margarita and pear cooler, and relax.

One of my favorites on Polk.
author: Albert K.

description: Just got refused admittance because my actual ID (which I've used without a problem for 6 years) was judged to be fake - in the rudest possible way, with no explanation. Offered to go and get a passport, but the bouncer was apparently put off by my indignation and decided I couldn't get in under any circumstances. So I (and seven of my friends) left, and have vowed never to return to this abysmal establishment again. Join us, won't you?
author: Sachin M.

description: came here on a Sunday because I had 2 free drinks comp cards. Pretty chill cozy bar. Also was here for the $1 beer with purchase of any shot, as well as $1 shot with purchase of any beer. They have a big variety of alcohol choices. The wall behind the bar was really extensive and stocked with all types of alcohol.
author: Irma B.

description:
Horrible customer service.
Both bartenders were rude as hell.
If you have bought the Groupon for this place don't even bother.  They will ignore you and act so rude.
How both bartenders acted we took with a grain of salt and left a $20 tip because obviously they both need it more then we do.
My fiancé still had a Groupon to use and he just marked redeemed because he never wants to come back & I don't blame him.
Walk a few blocks down to Kozy Kar place is awesome, people are so nice, & the bartenders take care of everyone.
author: Justine G.

description: OK this is the second review ive ever written, and it's definitely is necessary. First and foremost the lady that was working tonight seemed to be on drugs (heroin,coke, just drunk idk) anyways, us being good humans and not trying to judge the woman , we order drinks, a blue moon for him and a shot of Bombay on the rocks for me. (That of corse didn't go smoothly he was accused of having a fake ID, the drug lady did something on her phone to confirm its legitimacy) after that was cleared up we went to the back table and played connect four for about 40 minutes and my fiance went back to the bar to grab another beer. The lady said she was busy he had to wait so he asked the guy working for a beer and this guy told him he's had too much to drink and suggested that he have some water. What? After one beer? We just left and will never come back lol weird people
author: Sydney W.

description: BYOF (Bring your own food) and the barkeep will pair your poison with the meanest cocktail or beer! Rest assured... tellies aglore (10 i think).
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: I really enjoyed the drinks here. However the cabin smells like farts. Like really badly.
author: Heather Z.

description: Excellent bartenders and great drinks! They have a pretty good selection of house cocktails but will make a good drink regardless of what you ask for. Can be pretty busy on any local game night as they have a ton of screens.
author: Ahmed M.

description:
Their Signatures cocktails are really special this is why I gave it 5 Stars, they have 4 types of barrel aged cocktails. they age them for 4 weeks or more, I tried the Black Buffalo and the Artichoke Negroni, The Scent and the Flavor for both were amazing, I enjoyed every single sip.... they are little bit pricey, 14$  each on a Saturday afternoon, I used a Groupon so it helped little bit, But It is totally worth it. 
They are so good I really wanted to the ask the lady behind the bar if I can buy one whole bottle of that as they have 4 bottles one for each cocktail next to the register.
author: Maher S.

description: Great experience.  GF and I were walking by as I was getting an oil change.  Has a great vibe, saw a couple playing a game of chess at the bar.  Bartender was super friendly, had all the baseball games on.  Great beer's and a $1 Jameson shot if purchased with a beer.  Bartender did a great job of removing head from the taps, was probably a hot day, I like seeing that extra attention.
author: Jason F.

description: Friendly bartender. Got good prompt service and they do a nice pour. Gotta love the shamrock on Guinness and I don't even drink beer. Looks nice though. There weren't a lot of people here and we were able to find parking easy. So that made the experience even better.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Came here during Santa run. Great drinks, service limited due to large influx of people. Great selection and prices are decent. Small area but easy for bar hopping and hard to find parking.
author: Amy Y.

description: The bartenders were awesome. They let us sample a few of the beers, as we were having trouble deciding, and they went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Would definitely come back, despite the music being pretty average.
author: Hillary Q.

description:
Convenient location and the decor is very different than other bars. It reminds me of a cabin in Tahoe, which I suppose it the point. But anyway, plenty of clean and large tables- good for small groups. 

However, I really disliked the crowd. Guys kept sitting at our table and saying, "hey when are you buying me a drink?" Complete turn off. It's also difficult to get the bartenders attention sometimes.
author: Winnie T.

description: This place is dope. It's as groovy as the day is long. Jen, Henry, and the rest of the staff can make a mean cocktail and poor a wicked beer. It really feels like a cozy neighborhood bar...but it's on Polk street! It's a great place to unwind after work amor head out for the night. Top notch!
author: Ben C.

description:
I really liked this bar and I think that if I were to come back, the potential for another star is pretty high. That said, it wasn't my favorite place because nothing in particular made it too special, looking back at the highlights of our trip. I had a gingery mule cocktail, which was pretty tasty and something I'd order again, but nothing too out of the ordinary. Everyone else was pretty pleased with their cocktails and the bartender was super nice, though she seemed a little cold once we started getting warmed up and chatty.

Like I said, nothing really stands out here, but I can't say anything negative either. I wouldn't turn down an opportunity to return.
author: Kaitlin D.

description:
Drinks are good, space is nice, ample seating in the back for bigger groups.
There are rows of TV for the dudes that want to catch up on sports orrrrrr are on a failing date.

They have good specials/happy hours (ex. Industry Special, so on)

The staff are not pushy nor do they hover, but they make funny light conversation when needed!

Came here with a group of 8 and we all had a great time :) Will definitely come back!!
author: Selina W.

description: The hubby and I came here after dinner for a drink. It was full but not too busy (I think it was only like 9 or 9:30) and we were actually able to find a seat. The bartenders were nice and they have a lot of nice alcohol behind the bar. I liked that they have tvs to watch sports but you can actually order a good drink. All in all it was a cool vibe and if we were in the neighborhood more often I could see coming in for drinks or to watch whatever sport is on.
author: Courtney S.

description: Quick update: I've been back a few times. First time back post-review was weird, but the last two times have been great. The bouncer and I shook it out and all is right in the world! Will continue to recommend Cabin to my friends, particularly over Harper & Rye where it always seems to be way too damn hot
author: Preetesh B.

description: A tad small and narrow on the inside so it tends to get crowded on the inside but a fun atmosphere. They have a nice selection of whiskeys here. I had the Black buffalo cocktail which was super good! Bartender was knowledgeable and even let us taste several different types of Fernet.
author: Teresa C.

description:
I didn't want to give this place a great review at first because it will only be a matter of time until it gets taken over by the Marina crowd :( That being said this is my new favorite spot but I'm biased since one of my favorite bartenders from Black Thorn is here. 

Pluses
-This is a great place to watch sports lots of TVs
-The cocktail menu is great love the Moscow mules 
-The whole place has been renovated which means the hardwood looks amazing and the seats are all comfy. I don't think I've ever sat on a stool that was so padded and comfortable. 
-There are little round tables towards the back for those who don't want to sit at the bar. 
-Clean bathroom
-If your next store at the wine bar you can pop in here real quick for a shot

Minus
-I like when there's a mirror along the back wall of bars so if you're sitting there you can see who walks by or is coming up behind you without turning around. There was no mirror :/
author: Marisa M.

description:
Nice spot for a drink.  The place seemed pretty new as the stools and benches were comfortable and still firm.  It really does feel like you're in long long cabin once you're inside.  They have a flat screen that just shows a fire place burning.

Drinks were decent however there was no table service when we were there.
author: Henry S.

description: Great location, awesome staff, perfect drinks. My friends and I love coming here to watch our beloved Houston sports teams; Astros, Rockets and Texans.
author: Jose G.

description: We came here w a Groupon and initially we thought it was only for 2 drinks however we got hooked up w 4 drinks for a $12 groupon .... highly recommended.   Do not get a whiskey sour ..ask for their specialty drinks
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: This is where we closed out St. Patty's Day!  We had an excellent time.  It wasn't too crowded.  We found a high-top table in the back, and aside from some bathroom traffic, it was nice to get some elbow room from the other patrons.  The menu has about a dozen fu-fu drinks, but we went for simple stuff like KettleOne and soda.  They do have some more exotic alcohols, so definitely peak at the bottle selection before you put in the order.  They also have about 5 LCD TV's around, so from nearly anywhere in the bar, you can keep an eye on the game.  I really don't care about the game, but its funny to watch everyone else seemingly non-nonsensically cheer at random moments.  Overall, great experience.
author: Jane O.

description: Dark, loud and lots of alcohol! I enjoyed a few drinks at this spot with the aid of a Groupon. Seems like it could get crowded on a night with a big game being televised.
author: Sharon W.

description: So I am probably one of the few people that had been to this place when it was the bigfoot lodge.  I gotta say, I really like this place.  I used to go grab a drink at Amelie, which I still love, but when it's too crowded I pop on over next door and always find a seat and service.  The drinks are good and the service has been great every time I have been there.  There are many options on Polk Street but it's a good spot that never seems to have a line and always has space.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Great place and even better bartender in Rebecca.  Love Cabin and going for early football on Sunday's.
author: Steve T.

description:
It's funny that I never went to this place when it was the Bigfoot Lodge but went 4 or 5 times in the past two months now that its' been renamed Cabin.

The drinks are not cheap but still cheaper than any other place around. If you come during happy hour (anytime before 7pm any day of the week) you'll get $4 drafts, $3 bottles and $5 well drinks. Perfect spots for sports as they have plenty of TVs. If you get there early, get a table in the back. It's my new go to place for World Cup, NFL etc... Older crowd (late 20s early 30s) than other Polk bars.

They have a 50% off Groupon right now. Make sure to have it on your phone as they dont accept printouts.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
3 stars for the much-improved interior updates and lack of crowd when we came in around 6pm Friday night.  Cabin is a cleaner, slightly more sophisticated upgrade from the old digs, Bigfoot.

That's where the good news ended though.  My drink, the jalapeno margarita, was straight up heat in a mason jar.  The heat was so overpowering and the drink lacked the hint of sweetness one craves in a margarita. I had the bartender add a little sweet and sour, which didn't improve things.

Bf ordered one of the blackberry cocktails which actually tasted like nothing. Didn't know that was possible.

Attentive service and I was all for the low-key vibe, but won't be running back to Cabin.
author: Brianna M.

description:
decient happy hours, nice bartenders and a good selection of drinks.
This place is good when there is almost no one there although once the crowd gets started its just like that rest of polk street is becoming which is the next marina.
author: Cescilia A.

description: Stumbled in this bar during our three hour wait for House of Prime Rib.  Great surroundings complete with the most comfortable bar stools for us to sit on while watching Sunday night football. I especially love the whiskey sour here (no egg white foam but equally delicious). They make it with their own personal sour mix that has egg whites in it and you can tell! The drink is a perfect combination of sweet and sour. They also allow you to choose your own whiskey. They top it with a special black cherry (not the usual overly sweet maraschino) that has an amazingly balanced cherry flour.  The bartender was extremely helpful and informative. He spent the time to go over different beers they served and even allowed us to have a taste before deciding. Great cocktail prices! A go to bar on Polk street!
author: Caroline T.

description: The bartender (forgot her name) really made the experience. She recommended excellent (never heard before) drinks that were fantastic!
author: Matt E.

description: This is one of the only places in the city where I have found a Sour Beer (a Duchesse De Bourgogne) on tap, and it was so freaking good. (Yes, the 'freaking' was necessary!) If you like sours, get there ASAP before they tap out. (Which I pray they never do!)
author: Jane F.

description: Not a bad place, but also not a place I will go out of my way to go to.  The crowd seemed to contain a highly-concentrated overflow of Marina bros and obnoxiously intoxicated females, but the bartenders were really nice and attentive.  It's a good nearby bar to pop into if you have a long wait for dinner at House of Prime Rib :)
author: Kristen F.

description: Awesome small place!!! Not bad drinks either!! Would go back for sure, losses a point for only the words smallest bathroom
author: Bob U.

description: Meh whatevs. I didn't hate it; it was at a convenient enough location so it's easy to get to Polk bars and eateries afterwards, but it isn't a bar I would want to stay at for very long. I was there on a Saturday night and it was insanely packed and loud and hot and extremely difficult to get a bartender's attention. That is a lot of "ands," I know, but that's because there were a few too many things that made me not crazy about the joint. Oh, and the drinks were mediocre at best and overpriced. My friend ordered a vodka tonic and it tasted like lightly flavored water. I hate tonic, vehemently, and I couldn't even tell that it had tonic in it because it was so watered down. No bueno, Cabin. No bueno.
author: Stephenie S.

description:
This is a really great neighborhood bar. The first thing I noticed when walking in is that the vibe was super chill and the clientele were older and seemed like native San Franciscans. I also noticed the fireplace on a screen in the back - pretty funny. 

We sat at the bar and were immediately welcomed by the friendly woman bartender. She talked to us about her day and we had great conversation. Highly recommend this bar for happy hour (cheap prices) and to get a quick drink before a dinner reservation on Polk St. A full bar with a really extensive selection (3 shelves of hard liquor at the bar).
author: Harmony P.

description: The bartender was excellent!  She was very nice and makes awesome drinks!!!   I wanted to put her in my pocket and take her home!!!
author: Ro S.

description: I went here because of the awesome groupon deals they offer and I was not disappointed. Its a small bar on polk street surrounded by a ton of competition, hence i'm assuming the groupon deals. Excellent cocktails, very polite staff and great service. I'll def be going back.
author: Mitch M.

description: Loved this place! I originally was next door at the wine bar thinking, "When in Rome" or California... But it was way too packed and a bit more fancy than I was dressed for. Cabin was much more my pace. Laid back and dare I say, cabin chic? It was a cool cozy atmosphere but most importantly were the welcoming bartenders, Rebecca and Jason. I got a couple glasses of wine there, so I can't comment on the cocktails, but I'd definitely return to check them out. 5 stars because fore a bar is all about feel :) thanks guys!
author: Amanda M.

description: Day drank here on a Sunday and it was pretty quiet. Unique cocktail menu. 3 stars but it probably has more potential in the evening.
author: Michael M.

description: This place is so clean! Cool spot for boozing with friends and bartenders are  really friendly.
author: Michelle D.

description: Wow we stumbled upon the cabin and were blown away!  The bartender Jason fixed us up with a watermelon drink that we code named the "J Wat". It is amazing. The music, ambiance, and drinks were insane. I highly recommend this lounge!
author: Maryanna Q.

description: This bar used to be so smelly and just gross.  But now it has some higher end spirits, it no longer reeks of funk, and the bar crew aren't scary anymore either.  Plus they give deals for industry folk.  So happy about this place getting a facelift.
author: D B.

description: I kinda don't want to leave a good review...I want to keep this place a secret!  Great venue for watching sports, very cozy, good drinks, prices consistent with Polk St.  Service seemed friendly and efficient enough.
author: Mike D.

description: Our second stop on our bar crawl. I just fell in love with the warmth of feeling like Ive gone into a cabin. I could see just hanging here and watching a game drinking beer.. This day I was trying to get all the way turnt-up (I was successful) So i ordered a tequila and a pbr backer. Simple, gets the job done. Fairly hard to actually not deliver on this order. Really all in all, a uneventful visit.
author: Desiree Y.

description: Jason is an exceptionally talented -  as well as charming and handsome -  bartender who can create delicious and original cocktails to satisfy every taste.  This city had many bars and a lot of attitude... Both Cabin and its staff is refreshing: genuine,  down to earth,  the real deal.  Great for happy hours,  date, or a quiet drink with friends after work.
author: Dapper C.

description: Very friendly staff and good menu! The layout is a bit weird because it has a narrow hallway. Loved it!
author: Dan A.

description: A nice place to stop at when on polk st. The atmosphere is cozy. They have a variety of booze. I'd being a friend back to start the night here.
author: Christina L.

description: Great bar with a beautiful laquered wood counter & cool bartender!  Fernet-Branca shots are what's up!
author: Roland C.

description: I love love love Cabin, it's my local neighborhood watering hole. The bartenders are friendly, the drinks are good and they have plenty of TV's to watch whatever you fancy. I also like the small touches like the flame log TV and the big open window near the front. It can get very crowded on Fri/Sat nights but otherwise it's a great place and one of the better places along Polk St.
author: mehul p.

description: Been here a couple times to grab drinks before dinner. Nice, chill atmosphere. Bartenders are friendly and welcoming, but more importantly know how/care to make a good drink! Barrel-aged vieux carre is smooth and perfectly balanced. I also ordered off menu by telling the bartender what qualities I like in a cocktail, and she made one spot on. LOVE this place and glad to be in the neighborhood.
author: Riz W.

description: Definitely digging this bar.  Lots of TV's. Attentive bartenders. Good cocktails. (Tap) Beer selection pretty decent. Bathrooms clean. One of my faves on Polk St.
author: Judi B.

description: I really liked this Polk Street Bar. Really delicious and creative cocktails and super nice bartender. She made me a citrusy gin drink which was probably the only time I have ever drank gin and not gagged. Went in on a Sunday evening, it wasn't too busy, maybe 8-10 there total. Bathroom was clean but only one stall, but it wasn't a bathroom you go into and lock the door, there's waiting area in the bathroom which I find awkward. Log cabin-esque interior which was kitchy and cute.
author: Kajal G.

description: Went to Cabin last night and I get the sense that this place is tanking. First off they need business which is why I think they are running a Groupon. Secondly, the workers there are rude and don't seem very happy to work there. Maybe when the  owner finally realizes that customer service is number 1 then maybe they will become a place where i spend my money on an overpriced cocktail. But for now off to the other million places in the city  to drink at. Cheers!!
author: V S.

description: Cool bar. Don't buy groupon. Bartender told my friends and I that we can't use our groupon since we're in a group. There is nothing on the groupon that says one per group. Plus she said we had 15 min to use our $40 worth of drinks and we can only have 1 drink at a time. Wtf? So I had to buy a round of shots and only one drink. Waste of my time and money. I'm here to have a good time and was planning on spending more then my groupon but she fucked that up and not getting a good tip
author: Monique P.

description: Awesome bar!!! Great cocktails, you can tell management takes their time with the menu and really puts their heart and soul into the drinks. Atmosphere was great. Plenty of TVs for all sports games. Will definitely be back and recommend to all.
author: Ryan H.

description: great vibe and love the theme inside.
author: Janet L.

description: First time I've ever been to this bar and I liked it right away. Cool vibe, good drinks... Later, being the klutz that I am I spilled my red wine all over their tables and floors and I felt so bad and the employees couldn't have been nicer! So sweet about how it always happens ( I doubt with red wine) and insisted on getting me another full glass. I tried to refute saying it was all my fault for not being more careful and the lady was so beyond nice not taking no for an answer. My group was already trying to leave so I feel bad I didn't stay after them pouring me a new drink but I will definitely back! Thank you for proving that there is hospitality in bars!
author: Julie P.
